metadata.title: CVE-2022-26381 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An attacker could have caused a use-after-free by forcing a text reflow in an SVG object leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 98, Firefox ESR < 91.7, and Thunderbird < 91.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26381` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
